file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 73-30-04-06 - FADEC MOUNTS - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FADEC MOUNTS - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the visual inspection of the FADEC antivibration mounts. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FADEC ANTIVIBRATION MOUNTS - DE- ALL 73-30-04-200-801-A ♦ TAILED INSPECTION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 73-30-04 Page 1 of 4 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 73-30-04-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FADEC ANTIVIBRATION MOUNTS - DETAILED INSPECTION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to do the detailed inspection of the FADEC antivibration mounts. (2) This task is applicable to all antivibration mounts of the four FADECs. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM MPP 73-22-01/400 - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION AMM TASK 73-22-01-000-801-A/400 FADEC - REMOVAL AMM TASK 73-22-01-400-801-A/400 FADEC - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To get access to the rear electronic compart- Ladder 1 available ment F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 73-30-04 Page 2 of 4 Rev 54 - Apr 27/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WARNING: BEFORE YOU THE TASK OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. • START 1/2. • FADEC 1A/2A. • FADEC 1B/2B. (2) Put the ladder in position, and open the rear electronic compartment door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) Remove the FADEC ( AMM TASK 73-22-01-000-801-A/400). J. Detailed Inspection of the FADEC Antivibration Mounts (Figure 601) SUBTASK 220-003-A (1) Examine the FADEC antivibration mount brackets and hardware as follows: (a) The antivibration mount brackets (1) must not have cracks or bends. (b) The core (top plate) (2) must not have cracks or bends and must not be loose. (c) The elastomer mount (3) must not have signs of wear. (d) The countersunk washer (bottom plate) (4) must not have cracks or bends and must not be loose. (2) If the FADEC antivibration mount brackets and hardware show any damage specified in the steps above, replace the FADEC (AMM MPP 73-22-01/400). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the FADEC ( AMM TASK 73-22-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Close door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) and remove the ladder. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from them. • START 1/2. • FADEC 1A/2A. • FADEC 1B/2B.
